metadata.title: CVE-2014-5044 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - low
metadata.description:
Multiple integer overflows in libgfortran might allow remote attackers toexecute arbitrary code or cause a denial of service (Fortran applicationcrash) via vectors related to array allocation.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-5044` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

gcc-snapshot - 20140715-0ubuntu1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

gcc-arm-none-eabi - 15:10.3-2021.07-4
gcc-arm-none-eabi-source - 15:10.3-2021.07-4
No subscription required

g++-mingw-w64 - 16

criterions.comment: gcc-snapshot package in esm-apps/jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '20140715-0ubuntu1').
gcc-arm-none-eabi package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '15:10.3-2021.07-4').
gcc-mingw-w64 package in esm-apps/jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '16').
